00037 #include "egs_pyramid.h"
00038 #include "egs_input.h"
00039 #include "egs_functions.h"
00040 
00041 #include <vector>
00042 using std::vector;
00043 
00044 static EGS_PYRAMID_LOCAL string __pyrX = "EGS_PyramidX";
00045 static EGS_PYRAMID_LOCAL string __pyrY = "EGS_PyramidY";
00046 static EGS_PYRAMID_LOCAL string __pyrZ = "EGS_PyramidZ";
00047 static EGS_PYRAMID_LOCAL string __pyr  = "EGS_Pyramid";
00048 
00049 template<class T>
00050 EGS_PyramidT<T>::EGS_PyramidT(T *P, const EGS_Vector &Xo, bool O,
00051                               const string &Name) : EGS_BaseGeometry(Name), p(P), xo(Xo),
00052     a(p->getNormal()), open(O) {
00053     nreg = 1;
00054     d = p->distance(xo);
00055     xop = p->getProjection(xo);
00056     if (fabs(d) < 1e-7) egsFatal("%s: the tip is too close to"
00057                                      " the base (%g)\n",getType().c_str(),fabs(d));
00058     if (d < 0) {
00059         a *= (-1);
00060         d *= (-1);
00061     }
00062     EGS_Vector v2 = p->getPoint(0), v1;
00063     n = p->getN();
00064     s = new EGS_Polygon * [n];
00065     vector<EGS_2DVector> aux;
00066     for (int j=0; j<p->getN(); j++) {
00067         v1 = v2;
00068         v2 = p->getPoint(j+1);
00069         EGS_Vector aj = p->getNormal(j);
00070         EGS_Projector *pro = new EGS_Projector(v1,xo,v2,"");
00071         EGS_Vector n = pro->normal();
00072         if (n*aj < 0) {
00073             delete pro;
00074             pro = new EGS_Projector(v2,xo,v1,"");
00075             n = pro->normal();
00076             if (n*aj < 0)
00077                 egsFatal("%s: n*aj < 0 for both normal orientations?\n",
00078                          getType().c_str());
00079         }
00080         aux.push_back(pro->getProjection(v1));
00081         aux.push_back(pro->getProjection(xo));
00082         aux.push_back(pro->getProjection(v2));
00083         s[j] = new EGS_Polygon(aux,*pro,open);
00084         aux.clear();
00085         delete pro;
00086     }
00087     is_convex = p->isConvex();
00088 }
00089 
00090 template<class T>
00091 void EGS_PyramidT<T>::printInfo() const {
00092     EGS_BaseGeometry::printInfo();
00093 }

00095 extern "C" {
00096 
00097     EGS_PYRAMID_EXPORT EGS_BaseGeometry *createGeometry(EGS_Input *input) {
00098 
00099         if (!input) {
00100             egsWarning("createGeometry(pyramid): null input?\n");
00101             return 0;
00102         }
00103         string type;
00104         int err = input->getInput("type",type);
00105         if (err) {
00106             egsWarning("createGeometry(pyramid): missing 'type' input\n");
00107             return 0;
00108         }
00109         EGS_BaseGeometry *g;
00110         vector<EGS_Float> p;
00111         err = input->getInput("points",p);
00112         if (err) {
00113             egsWarning("createGeometry(pyramid): missing 'points' input\n");
00114             return 0;
00115         }
00116         vector<EGS_Float> tip;
00117         err = input->getInput("tip",tip);
00118         if (err || tip.size() != 3) {
00119             egsWarning("createGeometry(pyramid): wrong/missing 'tip' input\n");
00120             return 0;
00121         }
00122         bool o = true;
00123         int is_closed;
00124         err = input->getInput("closed",is_closed);
00125         if (!err && is_closed == 1) {
00126             o = false;
00127         }
00128         egsWarning("%s: open = %d\n",type.c_str(),o);
00129         if (input->compare(type,__pyrX) || input->compare(type,__pyrY) ||
00130                 input->compare(type,__pyrZ)) {
00131             int np = p.size()/2;
00132             if (np < 3) {
00133                 egsWarning("createGeometry(pyramid): at least 3 points are "
00134                            "required to construct a pyramid\n");
00135                 return 0;
00136             }
00137             vector<EGS_2DVector> points;
00138             for (int j=0; j<np; j++) {
00139                 points.push_back(EGS_2DVector(p[2*j],p[2*j+1]));
00140             }
00141             if (input->compare(type,__pyrX))
00142                 g=new EGS_PyramidX(new
00143                                    EGS_PolygonYZ(points,EGS_XProjector(__pyrX)),
00144                                    EGS_Vector(tip[0],tip[1],tip[2]),o);
00145             else if (input->compare(type,__pyrY))
00146                 g=new EGS_PyramidY(new EGS_PolygonXZ(points,
00147                                                      EGS_YProjector(__pyrY)),
00148                                    EGS_Vector(tip[0],tip[1],tip[2]),o);
00149             else
00150                 g=new EGS_PyramidZ(new
00151                                    EGS_PolygonXY(points,EGS_ZProjector(__pyrZ)),
00152                                    EGS_Vector(tip[0],tip[1],tip[2]),o);
00153         }
00154         else {
00155             int np = p.size()/3;
00156             if (np < 3) {
00157                 egsWarning("createGeometry(pyramid): at least 3 points are required"
00158                            " to construct a pyramid\n");
00159                 return 0;
00160             }
00161             vector<EGS_Vector> points;
00162             for (int j=0; j<np; j++) {
00163                 points.push_back(EGS_Vector(p[3*j],p[3*j+1],p[3*j+2]));
00164             }
00165             EGS_Vector aux(points[np-1]-points[0]);
00166             if (aux.length2() > 1e-6) {
00167                 points.push_back(points[0]);
00168             }
00169             np = points.size();
00170             EGS_Projector pro(points[0],points[1],points[np-2],__pyr);
00171             vector<EGS_2DVector> p2;
00172             {
00173                 for (int j=0; j<np; j++) {
00174                     p2.push_back(pro.getProjection(points[j]));
00175                     EGS_Float d = pro.distance(points[j]);
00176                     if (fabs(d) > 1e-6) {
00177                         egsWarning("createGeometry(pyramid): "
00178                                    "points are not on a plane\n");
00179                         return 0;
00180                     }
00181                 }
00182             }
00183             g = new EGS_Pyramid(new EGS_Polygon(p2,pro),
00184                                 EGS_Vector(tip[0],tip[1],tip[2]),o);
00185         }
00186         g->setName(input);
00187         g->setMedia(input);
00188         g->setLabels(input);
00189         return g;
00190     }
00191 
00192 }
